name: zot-registry
description: zot is a self-hosted OCI image registry focused on simplicity, security, and cloud-native workflows. It supports replication, access control, and a minimal web UI and APIs for managing container images.
features: OCI compliance: Store and distribute container images following Open Container Initiative standards for compatibility.
Image replication: Synchronize images between registries for disaster recovery and geographic distribution.
Access control: Define granular permissions for repositories with support for authentication and authorization.
Vulnerability scanning: Integrate with security scanners to identify vulnerabilities in stored container images.
Garbage collection: Automatically remove unused image layers and manifests to reclaim storage space.
Image signing: Support content trust and image signing for verifying image authenticity and integrity.
Web interface: Browse repositories, tags, and image details through a minimal web UI for quick inspection.
API compatibility: Work with Docker CLI, Podman, and other OCI-compliant tools without modifications.
Storage backends: Choose between local filesystem, S3, or other storage backends for image layer storage.
Metrics export: Expose Prometheus metrics for monitoring registry performance and usage patterns.
Webhook notifications: Trigger external systems when images are pushed, deleted, or modified in the registry.
Minimal footprint: Run efficiently with low resource requirements suitable for edge deployments and small teams.
